applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several key reasons: 1) The regulation specifically deals with setting renewal prices where multiple insurance undertakings/intermediaries are involved. The document in question is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the structure and operation of an occupational pension scheme, not a general insurance product with renewal pricing. 2) The document shows this is a single-provider product offered by AIB Life, not a multi-provider insurance arrangement. 3) The scheme rules document focuses on death benefits and trustee responsibilities, with no mention of renewal pricing mechanisms or multiple insurance providers being involved in price setting. 4) The document explicitly states it is regulated under the Pensions Act 1990 and Taxes Consolidation Act 1997, not general insurance regulations. The pricing and premium aspects mentioned in the document (Section 2.3) are fixed amounts determined solely by AIB Life, not involving multiple insurance undertakings.
regulation_title: Responsibility of insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary where more than one insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary is involved in setting the subsequent renewal price
regulation_text: 318. Where more than one insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary is jointly responsible for setting the subsequent renewal price, each insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary shall take reasonable steps to assure itself that the subsequent renew al price is set in accordance with Regulations 314 to
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
